results.name: a(n) = A000010(A005940(1+n)).
comment: Each n occurs A014197(n) times in total in this sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16384
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
mathematica: f[n_, i_, x_]:=f[n, i, x]=Which[n==0, x, EvenQ[n], f[n/2, i + 1, x], f[(n - 1)/2, i, x Prime[i]]]; a005940[n_]:=f[n - 1, 1, 1]; Table[EulerPhi[a005940[n + 1]], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 20 2017 *)
program: A005940(n) = { my(p=2, t=1); n--; until(!n\=2, if((n%2), (t*=p), p=nextprime(p+1))); t }; \\ Modified from code of _M. F. Hasler_

(Scheme) (define (A290077 n) (let loop ((n n) (m 1) (i 1)) (cond ((zero? n) m) ((even? n) (loop (/ n 2) m (+ 1 i))) ((= 1 (modulo n 4)) (loop (/ (- n 1) 4) (* m (- (A000040 i) 1)) (+ 1 i))) (else (loop (/ (- n 1) 2) (* m (A000040 i)) i))))) ;; Requires only an implementation of A000040, see for example under A083221.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 19 2017
